intro: Paepalanthus alsinoides subsp. alsinoides, commonly known as the Alsino's burro's tail, is a succulent plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-draining soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
